alert.note: Alert for Caswell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 2:09PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Caswell, Charlotte, southeastern Pittsylvania and Halifax Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 205 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of heavy rain with embedded strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Yanceyville North Carolina, to Halifax Virginia. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. Heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain will pond on roadways. Locations impacted include... South Boston... Yanceyville... Halifax... Keysville... Charlotte Court House... Phenix... and Prospect Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Watch out for downed trees and tree limbs on area highways. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
